### Read the file and process the missing data

```{r}
### Check who left the bank in 2000, named the variable as "LeftBank"
### Check who didn't left the bank in 2000, and the income or age in 1999 were missing, we named the variable as "fixAge" and "fixIncome"
### for "fixAge"== TRUE, we substitute "NA" to be "4", which is the median
### for "fixIncome"== TRUE, we substitute "NA" to be "6", which is the mean

consumerDB = read.csv("dataset.csv")
## check : summary(consumerDB)
consumerDB$LeftBank = is.na(consumerDB$X0Online) & is.na(consumerDB$X0Billpay)
## check : View(consumerDB)
AgeMedian_1999 = median(consumerDB$X9Age,na.rm = TRUE) 
IncomeMean_1999 = median(consumerDB$X9Inc,na.rm = TRUE) 
AgeMedian_1999
IncomeMean_1999
consumerDB$fixAge = !consumerDB$LeftBank & is.na(consumerDB$X9Age)
consumerDB$fixIncome = !consumerDB$LeftBank & is.na(consumerDB$X9Inc)
consumerDB[consumerDB$fixAge,]$X9Age = 4
## check: View(consumerDB)
consumerDB[consumerDB$fixIncome,]$X9Inc = 6
### summary(consumerDB)
```

```{r}

## Creating Tenure levels
consumerDB$Tenure.Level = "0"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 3.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level 1"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 3.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 6.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level 2"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 6.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 9.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level 3"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 9.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 12.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level 4"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 12.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 15.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level 5"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 15.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 18.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level 6"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 18.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 21.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level 7"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 21.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 24.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level 8"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 24.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 27.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level 9"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 27.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 30.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level X0"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 30.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 33.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level X1"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 33.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 36.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level X2"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 36.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 39.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level X3"
consumerDB[consumerDB$X9Tenure > 39.00 & consumerDB$X9Tenure <= 42.00,]$Tenure.Level = "Level X4"
table(consumerDB$Tenure.Level,consumerDB$X9Online)
#as.data.frame(consumerDB$Tenure.Level,consumerDB$X9Online)
table(consumerDB$Tenure.Level,consumerDB$X9Billpay)

```
